title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Norfolk-Hampton Roads

content.rendered:
Norfolk is a city located in the state of Virginia and is a part of the larger Hampton Roads metropolitan area. It is one of the oldest cities in the Hampton Roads metropolitan area, and is a well-known historic, urban, financial, and cultural hub.

Norfolk, along with nine other cities, are officially known as the Virginia Beach-Norfolk-Newport News, VA-NC MSA. Norfolk is an important military and transportation point, with many railroad lines. Read on to discover more about the city, including the average rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads, and more!

Related: Is Living In Cohousing Communities For You? Let’s Find Out

Getting to know Norfolk-Hampton Roads

Norfolk was incorporated in 1705 and saw a tobacco inspection site set up here in 1730. Thanks to its great connectivity by water and rail, it developed into the most prosperous city in Virginia by 1775.

Known today as a port city, it has a major Navy and shipping presence. It was recognized as an ‘All-America City’ in 2013 thanks to its status as a hub of the Hampton Road area. Norfolk has a subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, and mild winters. The water bodies that surround it play an important role in moderating the climate of the area, which should keep you comfortable when you’re looking for rooms to rent in Norfolk-Hampton roads!

Finding rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

Find Rooms For Rent In Norfolk-Hampton Roads

Norfolk is located in the southeastern corner of Virginia and has an estimated population of 1,716,624. Being the central business district of the area, the average rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads can be higher than other cities in the area. Norfolk is bordered by multiple bodies of water, meaning it’s home to many pretty riverfront and bay front properties.

If you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads, here are some of the best neighborhoods to consider.

Related: Hacks To Organize Storage In A Small Bathroom

Top neighborhoods in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

  • Ghent: This neighborhood is home to the Virginia Symphony and the Chrysler Museum of Art. This makes it a great place for music and art lovers looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads. Rent here is on the higher side, but the shopping, dining and entertainment options sure make up for it! You’ll find many great independent shops, boutiques and restaurants to explore.
  • Downtown: Downtown is a vibrant neighborhood and a hub that is a great place to find rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads. The area has great walkability and there is a lot you can see on foot. It is also home to Town Point Park, and has great options for high-end shopping, dining and entertainment.
  • South Bayview: This neighborhood is great if you are looking for cheap rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads. With a more affordable average rent and a safe and peaceful environment, this is a great place for anyone. If you enjoy a more quiet and suburban life, this neighborhood may be the perfect one for you!

Related: The Do’s And Don’ts Of Sharing An Apartment For The First Time

Average rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

Related: How Do You Achieve Financial Freedom In Your 20’s?

University life in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

Norfolk can be a great place to study if you’re seeking dynamic city life with a rich culture and history. The city boasts a great school system and colleges, making it great for higher education or research. You can easily find cheap rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads as a student. Check out the living costs and some of the best colleges in Norfolk.

Top universities in Norfolk-Hampton Roads:

  • Old Dominion University
  • Norfolk State University
  • Virginia Wesleyan University
  • Hampton University
  • Tidewater Community College

Related: Time Management 101: How Do I Make Time for my Hobbies?

How transit friendly is Norfolk-Hampton Roads?

Downtown Norfolk offers great walkability and is best explored on foot. Many other areas of the city are also easy to travel on your own two feet. However, for longer commutes, you will need to look toward public transport and taxis. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads, jump on the many public transport options available and mingle with the locals!

1. Airports

Norfolk is primarily served by the Norfolk International Airport, the major airport in the region. Another airport that serves the city is Newport News/Williamsburg International Airport, which is usually a cheaper option that’s located 20 minutes North of the City. The Chesapeake Regional Airport, a smaller airport on the city outskirts provides aviation services too.

2. Buses

Buses in Norfolk and surrounding areas are operated by the Hampton Roads Transit (HRT). They operate a series of buses, shuttles, trollies, electric buses, and paratransit services. Check for bus stops if you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads. The bus routes and fares for Norfolk and other areas can be found on their website.

3. Taxis

Taxis in Norfolk are generally safe and cheaper as compared to other cities. However, you might run into difficulties finding one in some places. Hence it makes sense to book one in advance. Ride-sharing apps like Uber and Lyft are also available, which can be handy if you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads in an out-of-the-way area.

4. Ferries

The ferries in Norfolk are also operated by the Hampton Roads Transit (HRT) and are a great alternative way to travel. The routes and timings for the ferry can be found on the HRT website as well. The timings are divided into summer and winter timings and are subject to change. There is also a special route between North Landing and Harbor Park when the Norfolk Tides play a home game there. Other than this, there are boat taxis that will take you around the Norfolk and Portsmouth waterfronts.

Cultural activities in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

  • The Hampton Roads Naval Museum: This Navy museum is operated by the Naval History and Heritage Command. It celebrates the long history of the U.S. Navy in the Hampton Roads region of Virginia. If this is something that sparks your interest, consider taking the Naval Station Tour, too.
  • Cannonball Trail: This heritage trail connects many historic sites and popular attractions throughout the downtown area. A must-see if you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads and are settling here. Guided tours are available too, and the walk takes about 2 hours.
  • Norfolk Botanical Gardens: This garden is the largest and one of the oldest in the entire state. With many tours by season, events, and activities, it is a real hub of the city. Norfolk Botanical Gardens also provides an educational experience for visitors of all ages. It’s a great place to spend your free time amongst nature if you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads.

Dining in Norfolk-Hampton Roads

  • Baxter’s Sports Lounge: This place offers great food and drink and is the largest bar and lounge in Downtown Norfolk. With TVs, pool tables, and a full bar, this is a great place to catch a sports match or unwind after a day of exploring Downtown.
  • Freemason Abbey Restaurant: This unique restaurant is located in a 100-year-old Church and has been a part of Norfolk’s history since the 19th century. You can see the original stained glass while you enjoy a meal or drink at this restaurant. With a variety of meals and sets, along with an extensive drink menu, it is a great place to visit.
  • Vintage Kitchen: This restaurant offers sweeping views of the Elizabeth River and is a must-visit joint. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads, be sure to head here. The place serves a wide variety of excellent seafood, salads, and soups.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Norfolk-Hampton Roads? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
